page.description: Returns a count of the records deleted.
page.original:
&ltTBL>.RECORDS_DELETED() Syntax Deleted_Records as N = &ltTBL>.RECORDS_DELETED() Description The &ltTBL>.RECORDS_DELETED() method returns the number of Deleted_Records in the open table referenced by &ltTBL>. When records are deleted from a table they are not physically removed from the table. To physically remove deleted records from a table, you must pack the table using the &ltTBL>.PACK() method. Example This script packs the table to remove any space taken up by deleted records. tbl = table.open("c:\a5\a_sports\customer.dbf") deleted_count = tbl.records_deleted() if deleted_count > 0 then tbl.pack() end if
